snippet: Verizon and other companies that spent billions of dollars to build their Internet pipelines are fighting the F.C.C.
abstract: Verizon and other companies that spent billions of dollars to build their Internet pipelines and believe they should be able to manage them as they wish are fighting the Federal Communications Commission; FCC says they must keep their pipelines free and open; Verizon and FCC face each other in United States Court of Appeals for District of Columbia Circuit.
lead_paragraph: Verizon and other companies that spent billions of dollars to build their Internet pipelines are fighting the F.C.C.

headline.main: Verizon-F.C.C. Court Fight Takes On Regulating Net
headline.print_headline: Verizon-F.C.C. Court Fight Takes On Regulating Net
